summary: After the trio’s daring escape from Gringotts, Hermione immediately shifts into caretaker mode—casting healing spells, handing out dry clothes, and trying to steady herself amidst the chaos. Though physically and emotionally drained, she is quick to question Harry about his latest vision. Her concern grows when they realize Voldemort knows they’re hunting Horcruxes. Hermione argues against rushing to Hogwarts without a plan, worried about the danger and lack of preparation. Despite her reluctance, she agrees to go, hiding her anxiety behind readiness. Her mix of pragmatism and loyalty is on full display.
logline: Hermione nurses the group back from chaos, then reluctantly agrees to follow Harry into danger once again.
speech_style: Grounded and cautious; urgent when warning, quiet in worry
location: Forest edge near Gringotts escape point
emotional_state: Exhausted and anxious; balancing care with concern for what lies ahead
